title: Medial Side of the Thigh, Gluteal Region

questions.question: 1. Which muscle is the most superficial muscle on the medial side of the thigh?
2. Which nerve provides the primary innervation to the majority of the medial thigh muscles?
3. The adductor magnus muscle has dual innervation. Which part is supplied by the tibial division of the sciatic nerve?
4. Which muscle originates from the pubic bone and inserts on the medial tibia, assisting in both thigh adduction and knee flexion?
5. Which muscle is considered a major adductor of the thigh and is located centrally in the medial compartment?
6. Which muscle is the largest in the gluteal region and is a primary hip extensor?
7. Which nerve innervates the gluteus medius muscle, crucial for pelvic stabilization during gait?
8. What is the primary action of the gluteus minimus muscle?
options: Abduction and medial rotation of the hip

questions.question: 9. Which muscle in the gluteal region functions as a lateral rotator of the hip?
10. Which muscle located deep in the gluteal region contributes to hip external rotation?
11. The adductor brevis muscle is innervated by which nerve?
12. Which of the following is NOT a muscle of the medial compartment of the thigh?
13. Which muscle in the medial thigh is known for its role in both adduction and assisting with knee flexion?
14. Which nerve supplies the gracilis muscle?
15. Which ligament, known as the Y-ligament of Bigelow, is the strongest ligament in the hip joint and contributes to stability in the gluteal region?
